text:
- [Presenter] What effect
can the substitution

of a certain player have
on the course of a match,

and which teams are most
dangerous from set pieces?

Skill and set piece threads
the new Bundesliga Match Facts
powered by AWS.
(upbeat music)
The new Bundesliga Match Fact Skill

focuses on the individual
class of Bundesliga players.

Skills shows off the
stars' outstanding quality,
and is divided into four components.
A sprinter naturally stands out
because of his high maximum speed.
That's why he soars out with deep passes

just like Leverkusen's
Jeremie Frimpong here.

With a top speed of
36.07 kilometers an hour,

he's one of the fastest
players in the league.
But the sprinter doesn't just have
a very high maximum speed.

He's also able to unleash
it on a regular basis.
Take Gerrit Holtmann for example.

No Bochum player makes as many
sprints per game as he does.

- [Announcer] He's got
Gerrit Holtmann up with him.
Holtmann's got the speed to get through.

And he's put it through Schlaber's
legs to make it one-nil.
- [Presenter] The hallmark of a finisher
is not simply goals in abundance.

He also impresses with a high
degree of finishing efficiency
like Augsburg's Michael Gregoritsch.

If he gets the ball in the
danger zone, watch out.
- [Announcer] Gregoritsch!
- [Presenter] Or Nil's Petersen.
When he comes off the bench,

The Match Fact Skill
emphasizes his role as a sub
who carries a real goal threat.
And the crowd knows what's coming.
- [Announcer] Nils Petersen!
- [Presenter] An important skill

when a team's not in
possession, the ball winner.
He has the ability to recover the ball.
He intercepts the opposition's passes,

and stands out with
strong tackling skills.

Leipzig's Josko Gvardiol
is exemplary at this.

A ball winner not only
stops opponents attacks,

but also enables his team
to start a counter attack.
(upbeat music)
The prime example of an initiator
is Bayern's Thomas Mueller.
The league's assist king,

he always knows where
to find his teammates.

- [Announcer] It's another
assist for Thomas Mueller.

- [Presenter] It's all
about launching attacks.

It's also a specialty of
Leverkusen star, Florian Wirtz.

- [Announcer] Here is
Wirtz, juggles it away.

And he's got open ground to
run into now, Florian Wirtz.
He's got Shick waiting.
- [Presenter] But for an initiator,

the decisive factor is not
just the number of assists,
but also the so called second assist.
That's the penultimate pass
which ultimately leads to a goal.
As we see with Jude Bellingham here,

the initiator is capable
of completing risky passes,

is creative, and manages
to conjure up a goal threat
in mere seconds.

Sprinter, finisher,
ball winner, initiator.
The four skill components.

The new Bundesliga Match
Fact powered by AWS

is tailor made for identifying
the most important players
in different areas of the game.
A player can always be highlighted

if he's in the top 10 of
the respected category.
(upbeat music)
Statistically in the last three years,

every fourth Bundesliga goal
has come from a set piece,
which shows that dead ball situations
provide a significant goal threat,
and can be a real game changer.

Thanks to the new Bundesliga
Match Fact set piece thread,

it is now possible to
rank a teams performance

from set pieces compared
to the league average.

The goal threat is
calculated by a combination

of the quality of the
chance a score is put in,
displayed by the goal probability
and the real results of the set piece.
The calculation goes beyond distinguishing
between goal and no goal.
It also evaluates the quality of the shot
even if it doesn't go in.
Also more recent games are higher weighted

than games that happened
earlier in the season.
Take Hoffenheim.
Even though this Sinsheim club
scored less goals after corners

than Eintrach Frankfurt
until match day 23,

they still rank higher in
corner threat than the Eagles.

As they were able to generate
a high accumulated XG value,
and more dangerous shots.
This means in assessing the set piece,
a goal is of course increasing the value
but is not absolutely necessary.

In addition, the new Bundesliga
Match Facts powered by AWS
can be used to describe the performance
in different dead ball situations.

The goal threat after
free kicks of Union Berlin
in the season 21, 22 for example,
is way below league average.

However, when the ball's
by the corner flag,
it's tension in the air.

That's because they're the
second best team in the league
in terms of corner threats.
Performing 48% better on average
than the rest of the league.

One team are a cut above the
rest in terms of set pieces.

the raised arm of Freiburg's
Vincenzo Grifo means one thing.
Prepare to celebrate.

As Freiburg have currently
scored most goals
after corner kicks, as well as free kicks.
Creating a constant threat that is shown
by the new Bundesliga Match Fact.
(upbeat music)

from a set piece.

- [Presenter] The new Bundesliga
Match Fact set piece thread
offers true added value in the evaluation
of free kicks in corners.

Enabling the spectators to
get a feeling for the threat
a team possesses after a set a piece,

with the help of an easily
understandable metric.
